fields.description:
When using ec2-upload-bundle with Eucalyptus 3.3.0, the following error shows up:

{code}
ubuntu@ip-172-17-121-217:~$ ec2-upload-bundle -b raring-jenkins-master -m /raring/image.manifest.xml
ERROR: Error talking to S3: Curl.Error(6): Couldn't resolve host 'raring-jenkins-master.10.104.1.216'.
{code}

Cloud DNS settings are as follows:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	false
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	false
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.services.enabled	false
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	127.0.0.1
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	04de74e9-e70e-4a2a-84ba-302765f7d651
....
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-services | grep -i dns
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.216   	ENABLED   	27  	http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.216/
{code}

From the looks of the error, it seems that buckets are suppose to be a sub-domain of Walrus now.  If this is the case, should we make Walrus always be deployed with a DNS service by default?
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 x CLC, Walrus
* 1 x CC, SC
* 1 x NC

comments.body: Reopening issue so that it hits the Engineering bug scrub

For this you can enable DNS in Euca and specify the S3 endpoint as walrus.<host>:8773. That should work. Without DNS support enabed in Euca this won't work. The S3 default is to use DNS bucket naming, virtual-hosting, now so we'll see this in more and more tools as they assume that the bucket is the first component of the host-name.

Whatever the solution is, I strongly encourage the implementer to avoid simply hardcoding "eucalyptus" as part of the DNS name that the server will respond to.  People have multiple clouds, and hardcoding a specific name in a DNS-level fix will make using them significantly more difficult.

Do we have a separate label, etc to track tool compatibility? This is a tool/config issue rather than an API/service issue. We should track it as such.

[~gholms], agreed, we ensure that our DNS is very generic.

Tried to reproduce using Eucalyptus 4.0.0 with the following setup and ec2-ami-tools version 1.5.0.0

{noformat}
CONFIG
machine00	CENTOS	6.5	64	BZR	[CLC WS OSG UI]
machine01	CENTOS	6.5	64	BZR	[SC00 CC00]
machine02	CENTOS	6.5	64	BZR	[NC00]
END_CONFIG
{noformat}

The following are my DNS configurations. Most of it were set by default by our QA systems and I manually enabled the walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance property

{noformat}
[root@g-08-10 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	true
PROPERTY	dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.instancedata.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.ns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.services.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.region_name	{}
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions	false
PROPERTY	dns.tcp.timeout_seconds	30
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	objectstorage.s3provider.s3usebackenddns	false
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	127.0.0.1
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	bfb8284f-4d91-4545-9159-4ab66da3f833
PROPERTY	walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance	true
[root@g-08-10 ~]# 
[root@g-08-10 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep -i dns
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.111.5.179   	ENABLED   	24  	http://10.111.5.179:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.111.5.179/
[root@g-08-10 ~]# 
{noformat}

From inside the instance, I tried to bundle and upload an image. Notice that the new AMI tools requires user to specify the signature (--sig 2) and that we need to remove the redundant "/services/Walrus" in the specified URL. Here's my results:
{noformat}
[ec2-user@euca-1-111-161-58 kvm-kernel]$ /usr/local/bin/ec2-upload-bundle -b chuck_b -m /tmp/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml -a AKIKTNSQQ8PQJ1V07V5V -s zl2aANXu73hk1OcskatTf8TGHnLXeYqkBL5nLTER --url http://walrus.g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773 --debug --sigv 2
Specifying url has been deprecated, please use only --region
Region determined to be us-east-1
The specified bucket is not S3 v2 safe (see S3 documentation for details):
chuck_b
Are you sure you want to continue? [y/N]y
curl -sSL -H "date:Fri, 21 Feb 2014 19:26:08 GMT" -H "content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIKTNSQQ8PQJ1V07V5V:oOryzXZVgIwv7fz7BgPufAF38IE=" -o /tmp/ec2-get-response20140221-1690-1l8ujsw-0 'http://walrus.g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/chuck_b?location' -w "Response-Code: %{http_code}\nContent-Type: %{content_type}"
Creating bucket...
curl -sSL -X PUT --data-binary "" -H "date:Fri, 21 Feb 2014 19:26:08 GMT" -H "content-length:0" -H "content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIKTNSQQ8PQJ1V07V5V:73vKZ2ZSovq1lExN/6WZKYWhblo=" -o /tmp/ec2-put-response20140221-1690-1l9eugv-0 'http://walrus.g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/chuck_b' -w "Response-Code: %{http_code}\nContent-Type: %{content_type}"
Uploading bundled image parts to the S3 bucket chuck_b ...
curl -sSL -H "x-amz-acl:aws-exec-read" -H "content-md5:C2t0eHMoBtnwFultngrHwA==" -H "date:Fri, 21 Feb 2014 19:26:08 GMT" -H "content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIKTNSQQ8PQJ1V07V5V:7ajG4R2giLZPgEM4gmYYkKUbam4=" -T /tmp/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.part.0 -o /tmp/ec2-put-response20140221-1690-iufns6-0 'http://walrus.g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/chuck_b/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.part.0' -w "Response-Code: %{http_code}\nContent-Type: %{content_type}"
Uploaded vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.part.0
Uploading manifest ...
curl -sSL -H "x-amz-acl:aws-exec-read" -H "content-md5:wUNe69HJ4L9n0hT3wvhk+g==" -H "date:Fri, 21 Feb 2014 19:26:08 GMT" -H "content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIKTNSQQ8PQJ1V07V5V:rz419iEQBiZExWdQR+QsaSCghPg=" -T /tmp/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml -o /tmp/ec2-put-response20140221-1690-1nknj9t-0 'http://walrus.g-08-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/chuck_b/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml' -w "Response-Code: %{http_code}\nContent-Type: %{content_type}"
Uploaded manifest.
Manifest uploaded to: chuck_b/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml
Bundle upload completed.
[ec2-user@euca-1-111-161-58 kvm-kernel]$
{noformat}

Thanks [~chuck] for confirming its resolved in 4.0.  Can we document this somewhere?  Maybe in the [Hybrid Cloud documentation guide|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#shared/hybrid_section.html] in 4.0?  Additionally, can we get this documented in our [Known Issues list on 3.4.x|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#release-notes/3.4.1/3.4.1_rn_issues.html]?

Thanks again for this.
[~hspencer], is there a DOC already associated with this? If not, I'll open one.

[~chuck],

I didn't see one attached to this ticket as a link.  The closest thing I saw to mentioning something regarding ec2-upload-bundle is DOC-424, which doesn't really focus on this issue.

Hope this helps.

[~chuck], this should be using objectstorage, not walrus, if you are in 4.0. Right now there is a bug in the 'testing' branch that lets euca/admin upload directly to walrus, but that will be fixed before release.

Can you try again using objectstorage and report results? Just want to be sure.
